pages.title: ⎧ Ace of Wands ⎧
pages.text: Root of the Powers of Fire$(br)      Natural Raw Force

A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.$(br)  The Aces all represent the primary, or root energy of their suit the source, or beginning, from which all the other cards grow and develop.$(br)  The Wands' element of Fire is also about beginnings. Fire energy initiates, or sparks, creative activity.$(br)  Thus, the Ace of Wands carries a special quality for the start of things - projects and ideas, action and movement, even emotions, especially

love.$(br)  This card signifies the first impulse of creativity.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Beginnings, new activity, creative impulse.$(br)  A time of action, of great energy.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  The energy can become chaotic, difficult to hold onto. Still very forceful but needs more focus.
